subject: p14147787
History: Patient with history of sarcoid, with increased cough and shortness of breath, assess for infiltrate.
Findings: Frontal and lateral chest radiographs were obtained. There are persistent, stable bilateral upper lung reticular nodular opacities consistent with history of sarcoidosis. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion, pneumothorax, or pulmonary edema is seen. The heart size is normal. Mediastinal and hilar contours are stable.
Impression: No focal consolidation to suggest pneumonia. Stable bilateral upper lungs zone fibrosis consistent with history of sarcoidosis.
